programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: A dog digs large ditches in its owners back garden and they need a bulldozer to fill them in. Plus, goats run amok at a birthday party and a canine steals underwear

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Brothers-in-law Brett and Wayde set about building a massive aquarium in the fan area on the San Francisco Giants ballpark

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA tries to save a dog that is found hanging by its neck in a yard, and investigators rush to reunite some puppies with their mother

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: After Tia and Sugar rescue a stray, they are shocked and race him to the vet. New worker Darius pursues his dream of working in the veterinary field

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Yuri is training in Bethel for a potential promotion when heavy ice forms on the wings of his aircraft. Meanwhile, Jim welcomes a greenhorn to the team

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Doug is sent on a mission to deliver volatile explosives to the island of St Lawrence, while in Unk, Ben has a shock when he crashes into a large bird mid-flight

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Gerry investigates a situation involving stray bullets while checking teal hunters along the border fence. Turtle hatchlings are released on South Padre Island.

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Rocky, a young pitbull, fights for his life after being bitten by a rattlesnake, while Sassquatch the cat suffers after a fire at his owners apartment

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson takes a tour of the USA to visit a few spectacular treehouses in the company of fellow enthusiasts and builders

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: The groups leave their cabins to hike out of the area and board the plane that will return them to civilisation, but face the threat of dehydration and freezing along the way

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto and Eivin prepare the barge to undertake its greatest mission yet - transporting wild buffalo. Meanwhile, Jane and Charlotte lead the Kilchers first all-female cattle drive

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Bear stays in the woods overnight after learning some life-changing news. Elsewhere, Sister Bird makes an unusual gift for Gabe, and Bam works on the house

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britains finest engineering

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: With the 25th anniversary well under way, there is some extreme painting going on at both ends of the tunnel - two murals that will link to each other across the sea. Cameras take a look at the catenary teams revolutionary new camera van that will transform the way they look for faults

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: A look at how Margaret Thatchers struggling public image was transformed in 1982 when Argentine forces occupied the British overseas territory of the Falkland Islands in the South Atlantic, with the triumph of the British forces making her reputation in the UK and around the world. On the home front she faced another challenge to her leadership from National Union of Miners, which called a UK-wide strike, while in 1984 the IRA bombed the Grand Hotel in Brighten in an attempt to kill her and her most senior colleagues

programme.title: The Falklands Play
programme.desc: Production of Ian Curteiss controversial drama which charts the political manoeuvring that went on behind the scenes of Margaret Thatchers government during the Falklands War. Patricia Hodge stars as the prime minister, with James Fox and John Standing. First aired in 2002

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team delves into the world of astronaut training, discovering what it takes to become a European Space Agency astronaut. As Europe looks to play a more prominent role in space exploration, the programme shines a spotlight on candidates pushing boundaries and preparing to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland amongst the stars. Helen Sharman, the first British astronaut, joins Chris Lintott at the Science Museum to celebrate the opening of the new space gallery

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: The three-part documentary continues as writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici, whose fledgling court prized the finer things in life. Successful courtiers had to have brains as well as brawn, and some looked to theorists like Niccolo Machiavelli for underhand ways to get ahead, while enlightened polymaths turned their minds to the heavens - and to ice-cream

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britains finest engineering

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: With the 25th anniversary well under way, there is some extreme painting going on at both ends of the tunnel - two murals that will link to each other across the sea. Cameras take a look at the catenary teams revolutionary new camera van that will transform the way they look for faults

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: A look at how Margaret Thatchers struggling public image was transformed in 1982 when Argentine forces occupied the British overseas territory of the Falkland Islands in the South Atlantic, with the triumph of the British forces making her reputation in the UK and around the world. On the home front she faced another challenge to her leadership from National Union of Miners, which called a UK-wide strike, while in 1984 the IRA bombed the Grand Hotel in Brighten in an attempt to kill her and her most senior colleagues

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Port Lockroy on Goudier Island in the British Antarctic Territory is the site of one of the worlds most remote post offices, which has a staff of four and is open to visiting tourists during the Antarctic summer. They share the neighbourhood with more than 3,000 gentoo penguins, and this documentary follows the trials and tribulations of the birds as they try to raise their chicks in these unusual surroundings. Juliet Stevenson narrates

programme.title: The Mirror Crackd
programme.desc: Miss Marple investigates a murder on a film set starring feuding Hollywood stars Marina Rudd and Lola Brewster. When a local woman dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail made for Marina, everyone assumes the actress was the intended victim because she had received death threats. However, the sleuthing spinster is not convinced. Agatha Christie mystery, with Angela Lansbury, Elizabeth Taylor, Kim Novak and Rock Hudson

programme.title: Angela Lansbury at the NFT
programme.desc: Actress Angela Lansbury talks to American columnist Rex Reed and answers questions from members of the audience at Londons National Film Theatre. First broadcast 26 September 1973

programme.title: Mercury Prize 2025: Album of the Year
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne presents coverage of the awards ceremony from Newcastles Utilita Arena, celebrating each of the 12 nominated albums through live performances before announcing the overall winner. The shortlisted artists are CMAT, Emma-Jean Thackray, FKA twigs, Fontaines DC, Jacob Alon, Joe Webb, Martin Carthy, Pa Salieu, PinkPantheress, Pulp, Sam Fender and Wolf Alice

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Two criminal brothers discover the orphanage where they were raised faces closure unless the nuns who run it can pay their tax bill, so the pair embark on an urgent mission to revive their old blues band to raise the money needed. Comedy, starring John Belushi, Dan Aykroyd, Aretha Franklin, James Brown, Ray Charles, Cab Calloway, Carrie Fisher, John Candy and John Lee Hooker

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: The three-part documentary continues as writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici, whose fledgling court prized the finer things in life. Successful courtiers had to have brains as well as brawn, and some looked to theorists like Niccolo Machiavelli for underhand ways to get ahead, while enlightened polymaths turned their minds to the heavens - and to ice-cream

programme.title: Angela Lansbury at the NFT
programme.desc: Actress Angela Lansbury talks to American columnist Rex Reed and answers questions from members of the audience at Londons National Film Theatre. First broadcast 26 September 1973

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: The historian uncovers the truth about Spains hero El Cid. He also investigates the attack on the city-state of Granada, waged by King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella, the horror of the Spanish Inquisition, and in the process discovers an unsettling story about one of his own ancestors

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Thirty years ago Janet Brown was bludgeoned to death in her home. Today, her children appeal to find her killer. Plus, how police in Wales caught a dangerous paedophile

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development progress of properties in Carlisle, Rosyth in Fife and Shepherds Bush, west London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian hosts as two teams seek bargains at Wetherby Racecourse. Experts Caroline Hawley and Colin Young assist the competing sides in their endeavours. Away from the contest, Danny takes a tour of Sheffield Botanical Gardens, where trustee Jill Sinclair shows him some of the 5,000 species of plants and trees that inhabit this urban oasis. Created in the early 19th century, the gardens were once home to a captive bear and monkeys. In more recent years they fell into disrepair before being restored in 2007

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Intelligence officer Adam finds a shipping container full of stolen cars in Felixstowe and tracker Richard searches for a heavy-duty roller stolen from a Bristol construction site. Plus, footage of thieves stealing a Range Rover from a driveway in Essex

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team battle the elements as they search for graduation pictures lost by a newly-qualified doctor and social media detective Mui makes a valuable discovery

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having returned to the UK, a young couple crave the outdoors lifestyle they experienced together for nearly three years living in New Zealand. Nicki Chapman helps them find a new home in the countryside of North Yorkshire, where they want to spend their spare time running, cycling and walking

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Cobbler Dean Westmoreland repairs a pair of boots belonging to blind photographer Ian, who was born profoundly deaf and lost his sight at 14. Metal worker Dominic Chinea is tasked with restoring a printing press from 1826 and the Bear Ladies give new life to a stuffed teddy that brought comfort to barn visitor Irwin at every hospital trip after he contracted polio at the age of three. Steve Fletcher and Cindy Welland repair a clock gifted to a school by Florence Nightingale in 1877

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Vernon Kay present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ravi steps up for his family and Nigel accidentally offends. Elaine gives Johnny food for thought

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: John from Holywell brings in a detailed working model of a Welsh coal mine, built by his miner grandfather more than 100 years ago. Its up to horologist Steve Fletcher to fix the mechanism while art conservator Lucia Scalisi restores its painted surfaces. The rest of the team get to work on a tattered Victorian writing box once owned by a trailblazing female journalist, a treasured 75-year-old doll and an extraordinary piece of British engineering history - the original 1930s design for the Humber Bridge

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: After the first banishment sends shockwaves throughout the castle, the traitors dont wait long to commit their next murder. As a new day dawns, the celebrity players turn their focus to a mission that forces them to work very closely as a team under punishing conditions. But as night falls, will they continue to collaborate at the round table and catch a traitor, or will they inadvertently banish a fellow faithful? Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and social media

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie is still reeling from the message she saw on Noas phone. But when the two are left alone together, something extraordinary happens. Is it the start of a new journey for Evie? Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie throws herself headlong at life, but Suz and Josh worry its too much, too soon. Noa realises he has to face up to his feelings. Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood, Suranne Jones, Adam Long and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand is host, with panellists comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and journalist Tom Peck joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kimberley Walsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Presenters Rav Wilding and Jennifer Reoch revisit a 1998 case in which 16-year-old Carmel Fenech disappeared without a trace. Plus, how a duo of determined detectives caught a man guilty of attempted rape

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh heads to in Rugeley, Staffordshire, to see a three-bed mid-terrace bought by a trio of experienced developers. Martin Roberts is in Cudham in the south-east London Borough of Bromley visiting a two-bed end-terrace cottage bought by a mother to help get her daughter on the property ladder. Jacqui Joseph is in north-west London to see two flats that may be better reverting back to one

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Wrexham, where the teams are ably guided around the antiques centre by experts Jonathan Pratt and Tim Weeks, before heading to the auction with Thomas Forrester. Christina monitors events and also discovers the appeal of model railways with an avid collector of original Hornby trains

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Bike recovery specialist Bilal hunts down a stolen £2,500 e-bike, which has a childs seat on the back. As a father himself, he is determined to get the cycle back. Meanwhile, tracker Richard is searching for a vehicle worth £40,000 stolen off a builders yard in south-west London. Its a race against time as theres a high demand for construction vehicles like this in countries like Ukraine - and thieves are cashing in

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: A scuba team takes on a familys epic 30-year search for a grandfathers mythical missing motorbike. Meanwhile, expert social media detective Mui hunts for clues about a precious ring found on the fells and local crafter Sally is challenged to turn discarded crockery into a ceramic wonder. Presented by Helen Skelton

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Wanting to leave town life behind them, a couple set their sights set on a new countryside home in Northamptonshire, and call upon the services of Ginny Buckley to help them find it. Ginny also discovers a beautiful green space on the outskirts of Kettering, where the towns residents can recharge their minds, bodies and green fingers

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a zoetrope - a groundbreaking form of Victorian entertainment and a precursor to moving film - and a pair of dilapidated designer chairs inherited by the owner when his twin brother emigrated to Florida. Ceramics conservator Kirsten Ramsay is asked to bring a broken little Buddha statue back to life and a woman is keen to see her dads old step-dancing boots as good as new

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina tries to distract herself and Oscar and Nigel join forces to see out a plan. Johnny realises his mistake

programme.title: Dragons Den
programme.desc: Fashion mogul Emma Grede, CEO of Good American and founding partner of SKIMS, returns as a guest Dragon, joining regulars Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Sara Davies, Steven Bartlett and Touker Suleyman. Latest investment suggestions include a headwear brand that trades brollies for bonnets, food-and-drink hampers for every occasion, a mobile grave-tending service and salon-quality hair dye. Hosted by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the players fall deeper into the game, a new day brings new suspicions among the Faithful. The mission forces the celebrities to communicate in a way no one expected and with the murdering hour approaching, the players take their seats at the Round Table. Will the Faithful work as a team to uncover a Traitor, or will the Traitors power grow stronger? Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Bishops Stortford, Hertfordshire, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics. Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming and Chris Mason are among the regular contributors

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts a battle of the nations special, featuring two contestants from each of the UKs home countries. With Gordon Smart and Amy Macdonald representing Scotland, Paul Brand and Josie DArby playing for Wales, Stephen Mangan and Leomie Anderson for England, and Jamie-Lee ODonnell and Bronagh Waugh representing Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Afterlife
programme.desc: When a single mum and her two kids arrive in a small town, they begin to discover their connection to the original Ghostbusters and the secret legacy their grandfather Egon Spengler left behind. Supernatural comedy sequel, directed by Jason Reitman and starring Carrie Coon, Paul Rudd, Finn Wolfhard and Mckenna Grace, with cameo appearances by Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Ernie Hudson, Annie Potts and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: Theres Life in the Old Dog Still
programme.desc: Stacey heads off to Lake Como to launch a new beauty product while Joe is left at home managing the kids, a poorly pooch and a long list of chores - so he invites his family over to help out. On Staceys return from Italy, Joe goes above and beyond to organise an epic date night - a singalong with one of Essexs biggest gospel choirs - and the family celebrate the arrival of summer with an epic pool party

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Stella feels the weight of recent events when her daughter arrives at school. Mitch finds himself in hot water after stepping in to help a struggling student and Dwayne returns to a mostly warm reception. Darius turns to Jack for guidance as he eyes a bigger role within the school

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The funfair arrives at Waterloo Road as Darius tries to escape the fallout from his actions. Has his luck finally run out? Agnes uncovers a secret that could blow a familys world apart, and Dontes loyalties are tested by a discovery that could end a colleagues career

programme.title: William Shakespeares Romeo + Juliet
programme.desc: A city is divided by the conflict between two feuding families - the fathers are bitter business rivals, and the younger generation are continually fighting in the streets. The son of one household falls in love at first sight with his enemys daughter - but the vendetta threatens their secret romance. Baz Luhrmanns modern update of Shakespeares tragic love story, with Leonardo DiCaprio, Claire Danes, Pete Postlethwaite and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: A distinctly average girl having an identity crisis dreams of becoming a Karen, with coaching help from her mum Karen. Written by and starring Francesca Tomlinson

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie is still reeling from the message she saw on Noas phone. But when the two are left alone together, something extraordinary happens. Is it the start of a new journey for Evie? Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie throws herself headlong at life, but Suz and Josh worry its too much, too soon. Noa realises he has to face up to his feelings. Drama, starring Aimee Lou Wood, Suranne Jones, Adam Long and Nabhaan Rizwan

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A tribute to formidable nurse Florence Nightingale, aka The Lady with the Lamp, charting how she revolutionised medical care

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a celebrity edition of the music-based quiz show, with contestants Kiri Pritchard-McLean, Lady Leshurr, Shane Richie, Russell Watson, Will Kirk and Shazia Mirza trying to name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs for the charity of their choice. Across three rounds, their knowledge is put to the test, as they attempt to identify huge hits from across the years. Whether its a song from the swinging 60s or the number-one track in todays charts, the teams must prove their ability to recognise songs from all genres of music - from pop to country, rock to RnB and many more

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: A game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them alll. Playing this week are friends from Brighton, sisters from London, and a married couple from North Yorkshire

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Actress Jane Horrocks joins the judging panel as Mama Ru tests the queens overacting skills with a series of scripts that pay homage to the UKs famous legacy of bonk-buster fiction. In uncanny timing, Jane, famed for playing the part of hapless PA Bubble in Absolutely Fabulous, is on hand to give her thoughts on a very special Ab Fab runway in A Night of a Thousand Sweetie Darlings. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr complete the judging panel as the queens once again fight for a much-coveted RuPeter badge and survival

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared, and as they reminisce, old feelings resurface. Maurice and Funmis romantic night out falls apart when they cant find a babysitter, forcing them to improvise at home - quietly, cautiously, and with one ear on the baby monitor. Over dinner, Errol finally works up the courage to ask Grace a big question - until Claude and Polly swoop in and ruin the mood. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit to the set of Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows its his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. A flawless day could launch his career, but as one mishap spirals into another, he must rely on his charm and determination to keep the production afloat - and his dream within reach. When Maurice misses yet another nursery event for Mayowa, Funmi finds an unexpected ally in a fellow parent. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena faces one final obstacle - he needs Simons help. Needless to say, getting his support comes with big strings attached. A run-in with Vanessa and her new boyfriend hits Kwabena like a ton of bricks. Maurice is blindsided when he learns that Mayowa has a girlfriend - something he knew nothing about. The revelation stings, forcing him to ask if the sacrifices hes making to fund his sons future are costing him the present. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.sub-title: The Adventurers/Getting Truffy With It/Good Vibrations/Puffs Perfect Picnic
programme.desc: Because Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are always up to new adventures, Bolly has dubbed them The Adventurers. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush. / Lilit is under pressure. Truff, the most talented musician in Mushton, has invited her, Mush-Mush and Chep to form a band with him. / Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet/The Hero Trap
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine. / The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Puffs Perfect Picnic/Run, Mushpie, Run/Watch the Storm/Lightning Bark
programme.desc: Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / When Chep asks Mush-Mush and Lilit to go storm-watching and they refuse, Lilit feels bad and convinces Mush-Mush to join their friend. / Fung and Miff have come across a rare piece of bark struck by lightning.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Special Delivery/The Perfect Fritter/The Art of Friendship/What a Stinker
programme.desc: Chep knows so many things about nature that Mush-Mush and Lilit are confident he’s not far from being an expert like Mushpot. / Sushi-Mushi tests new compost fritters recipes. When Mush-Mush gets to taste one, he can’t believe it: Sushi-Mushi has cooked the perfect fritter. / When Chanterelle sees how good Lilit is at painting, she offers to help her dig into her talent. / Chep is very excited: tonight, a rare and extremely stinky plant is going to bloom! But he already promised Mush-Mush to play their favourite game.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Mush-Mush The Predictor/Whos Eating Mushton/The Breathtaking Bolly Show/Work Like a Charm/Star Helpers/The Rollinator
programme.desc: Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was. / Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in. / Starmush’s back is stuck, and the Mushelder has no choice but to ask for help in Mushton. / Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! No one except Sumush who reveals himself to be a tough competitor.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Mass Control / Bear Under Control / Popcorn Party / Dancing with the Bears / Role Change / Lemming Tonic / Bear Itch
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers a gadget that controls various functions in the cabin. He will finally be able to rid of the Lemmings without even leaving the couch! / Grizzy turns the fridge into a safe. / The Lemmings have invented a new popcorn game which consists of throwing popcorn and catching it with their mouths. / Grizzy wants to learn to dance the mambo to please the she-bear hes in love with, for she truly adores this rhythm. / After receiving a terrible blow over the head Grizzy is no longer the same: he thinks hes a rodent! He tries to get the gang to adopt him. / Grizzy battles with the Lemmings over the couch. / Grizzy discovers that the frenzied break dance the Lemmings are doing is actually due to the fleas they are infested with.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Fool The Forest/Mushroomates/Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet
programme.desc: It’s Fool the Forest Day! Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Staff Of Wisdom/Let It Bee/Bird Call/The Hero Trap
programme.desc: Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. / The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out.

programme.title: Moley
programme.sub-title: Squirm’s Day Out/Three Gentlemen of Moletown/Who Arted/Trash Trash Trash!/Magic Rectangle
programme.desc: When Moley helps take care of the worms at Dotty’s Adopt a Worm Rescue Center, the Gardener sends Squirm to pose as a homeless worm and help him steal Manny. / When Moley’s Keeper duties are pulling him in too many directions, he gets Manny to create multiple Moleys! / When Dotty joins an art competition Moley is afraid her art won’t appeal to the snooty judge so he casts a spell that causes her art to come to life! / When Manny accidentally transports a heap of trash into Moletown, Moley attempts to recycle it by fixing up the town. / When a cell phone falls into Roley Poley park from the Great Above, the entire town is mesmerized by it and Moley must break the “spell” it has on them.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie decides to get her own back for missing out on a trip to Paris, determined to make Doug pay for insisting they go on a motorhome holiday. Kevin James and Leah Remini star

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug learns Carrie is turned on by an Italian accent he has mastered, but worries that she is falling out of love with his real self, while Arthur finds inspiration between the covers of a book. Kevin James and Leah Remini star

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra is too ill to take Ally to a pyjama party, so Ray reluctantly agrees to do the honours. Unfortunately it means coming face to face with Peggy, an old enemy who physically assaulted him during a charity event

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra wonders how Ray would cope if she met an untimely end, and picks an attractive friend to replace her as his new wife - but cannot help being hurt by his enthusiastic response to the idea

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra throws a bridal shower for Amy, but Marie tries to take over and monopolises the event. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Monica Horan

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin helps trap an unfaithful husband, while Roz and Frasier attend a conference on behalf of the radio station, and find themselves with no choice but to share a room. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and Peri Gilpin

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink lands a job as guest host on a morning TV show, and finds himself considering a permanent move from radio. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.sub-title: To Thine Old Self Be True

programme.desc: President of Moes Southwest Grill, Paul Damico, goes undercover to check the standards he values are still being met. programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £130,000 budget; will any of them impress these newly-weds enough for them to put in an offer?

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host in Glasgow, 52-year-old civil servant Lydia, plans to excite her guests with an evening dedicated to her days as a professional club dancer. Shes serving up a selection of tried-and-tested classics, but with tension rumbling on following some constructive criticism earlier in the week, will locally sourced food and a rave in the garden shed impress her guests?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sally and her daughter Tara are on the hunt for a holiday home in Manilva, Spain, for all three generations of their family to enjoy. Craig Rowe shows them five properties for their budget of £190,000, from a cute and quirky townhouse to a place with a tantalising terrace

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: A catch-up with two sets of house-hunters who needed room to grow. In 2019, first-time buyers Becky and Adam were looking for their first family home in Essex. They were keen to take on a project, and Phil Spencer found them a stunning house with real renovation potential in Tollesbury. In 2021, Kinga and Dave were moving from their London rental to Leeds to be closer to family. How are the couples getting on since their first appearance?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Marcus and Abi, who are building a luxurious off-grid family home deep in 20-acre woodland in Pembrokeshire on a budget of just £100,000. Granted permission through the One Planet Development planning laws, which are unique to Wales, they are armed with determination and timber from the surrounding forest. With no detailed plans, the project pushes the limits of design and endurance, and proves a raw, physical adventure that defies convention and challenges many of the ideas around what a home should be

programme.title: Britains Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Broker Josh Hamilton-Fletcher is searching for a new home for Rob, who wants to downsize from his £15 million beach house on exclusive Sandbanks. In Essex, Simon Pelling lists Churchfields, a £3 million home thats been on the market for six months, while Ed Casson is selling the grade II listed Old Rectory - a Victorian house which is also the ancestral home of George Washington

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding present a Bake Off first as the contestants face meringue week, starting off by making mini meringue tarts in the signature, before the more delicate task of souffles in the technical. To end, judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith challenge them to produce a showstopping meringue ice cream cake - before deciding which of the hopefuls hasnt quite come up with the goods

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Wellingborough, Northamptonshire, to pick up a 1988 Fiat Uno Turbo, one of the fastest hatchbacks of its time. The car belongs to car salesman Gerry, a dyed-in-the-wool boy racer. Sadly, Gerrys ill health has meant that the Uno has been tucked away and left to rot on his drive. His friends and family hope the boys treatment can bring some joy back into Gerrys life

programme.title: Minimum
programme.desc: An Indian woman moves to Belgium for an arranged marriage, only to be kept a virtual captive by her secretive mother-in-law. Gradually the newlywed discovers that everything she was told about her husband was untrue, and slowly loses hope - until she meets a French language tutor. Drama, starring Rumana Molla, Geetanjali Kulkarni and Saba Azad. In Hindi and French

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: In south Wales, siblings Toni and Andrea are first to host, aiming to provide an authentic Italian experience for their rivals, who in turn serve up Spanish food and posh pub grub. Second to host are Dan and Rhys from La Cocina Tapas, who hope to see off the competition with their fresh Spanish servings

programme.title: Jamies One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver offers a solutions-based guide to make brilliantly easy and delicious meals all cooked in one pan, pot or dish. In this episode, he whips up super-speedy smashed lemongrass chicken, sweet potato chilli with homemade nachos, and a chocolate party tray cake with tinned mandarin and buttercream filling

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Catherine and Nigel four years after their first visit when they helped them decide what to do with their home in Larne, Northern Ireland. Catherine wanted to move from the disjointed small roomed bungalow in an isolated location but Nigel, who didnt want to buy the property in the first place, was in love with their large garden with stunning views. While Phil took the pair to see some impressive but affordable houses, Kirstie came up with a plan to repurpose their space. Now theyre back to see if the pair stuck to their decision

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug gets carried away and tells too many home truths when he makes a speech at a celebratory dinner for his boss. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Tom Amandes

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.desc: Debra and Marie shame Ray into giving Robert a second bachelor party to make up for his disappointing first attempt

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Heather and John love Greece so much that they want their very own characterful bolthole on Crete. programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.desc: The host travels to the remote Lord Howe Island, a tiny Pacific gem off Australias east coast. Isolated and self-sufficient, the islands residents thrive using its natural resources amid a close-knit community spirit. George explores a remarkable multigenerational renovation - a home built on sweat, ingenuity and a family legacy so moving it brings him to tears. He visits a stunning coastal retreat sought after by the rich and famous, where style meets seclusion, before diving into an ocean paradise where coral gardens line backyards - and friendly turtles virtually mix with humans

programme.title: Taskmaster

Along the way, he meets a range of colourful and questionable characters who offer real insight into how value is created, as he tries to determine how much of the entrepreneurial dream he is being sold is legitimate and how much of it is a bluster of hot-air and delusional self-belief

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers are on the lookout for a suspected cloned car, a vehicle disguised as another by copying its number plate, as they believe it is being used to commit crime. When its spotted, four suspects make a run for it, and one is recognised as someone who rammed a police car weeks before. On the M1, officers tail a car linked to a known repeat offender and as several units pull over the car, the driver suddenly jumps into the back seat. Searching the vehicle, the cops make a worrying discovery

programme.title: Dead Man Walking: Inside Death Row
programme.desc: Dan Walker embarks on a hard-hitting investigation to uncover the truth about capital punishment in the US. He explores the reality of life on death row and secures the access to see exactly what is involved in carrying out a state-sanctioned execution. Reflecting on his findings, Dan considers whether the UK could or should ever reinstate the death penalty

programme.title: Wandsworth Prison: Out of Control
programme.desc: An investigation into one of Britains most troubled jails, where men are sharing cells designed to hold one person, and inexperienced staff are struggling to cope. This leads to a multitude of other problems, including locking inmates up 23 hours a day, which turns them on to drugs or affects their mental health. Last year the Chief Inspector of HM Prisons declared emergency action was needed, prompting the Government to stump up £100million - but in spite of this, the Victorian prison appears on the brink of collapse

programme.desc: The couples take some time apart as the group splits in two for separate days out. But the relaxation soon turns to drama when one groom confesses his true feelings about his bride, and the burden of a long-hidden secret causes an explosive clash for one pair

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard attempt to distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows the progress of their work on the Air Force guidance system. Raj and Stuart look after baby Halley, while Penny and Amy take Bernadette out

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues at the university, prompting their first fight since moving in together. Raj considers trying to live without financial support from his father, who thinks he is spoilt

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer gets trapped in a cave after trying to acquire a piece of stalactite during a family walk, leaving Marge, Maggie and Bart to go in search of help. As they wait, Lisa passes the time by telling her father a long and very strange tale in which she seeks refuge at Mr Burns mansion

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns sends Homer to train new workers in India, where he is worshipped and granted control of the plant. Meanwhile, Patty and Selma kidnap McGyver star Richard Dean Anderson - who provides his own voice - from a Stargate SG-1 convention to teach him a lesson

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
programme.desc: Bart is on his best behaviour as he tries to win the affections of a girl at his school, while Lisa reports on what Springfield will look like in 50 years. With the voice of Anne Hathaway (Les Miserables)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart faces a tough test at school when he gets a bullying new teacher who seems to want to crush his spirit, so the spiky-haired tearaway becomes determined to fight back. Meanwhile, the family attends a hippie-style community festival. With the guest voice of Willem Dafoe

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Two divorcees go in search of a more successful match, and a woman who despairs of ever finding the right man finds her head turned from her date to another man in the restaurant. A barbershop owner tries to settle his nerves by drinking heavily before the date, and an unconventional neuroscientist looks for love with an artistic woman who has always put other peoples needs first, but now wants something for herself

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, focusing their attentions on Sitting on a Fortune, Close to Me, You, Nadiyas Fast Flavours, Animal, UFO Witness, This Mornings Spin to Win feature and the ITV News. Narrated by Craig Cash. From November 2021

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: An edition first shown in November 2021 in which the armchair critics share their opinions on The Graham Norton Show, Mary Berry: Love to Cook, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special, Celebrity Antiques Road Trip, Strictly Come Dancing, The Lakes with Simon Reeve, Sex Unzipped, and This Morning. Narrated by Craig Cash

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Married couple Ashley and Tanya are seasoned swingers, but theres one boundary the Leeds couple have never previously crossed - trying to seduce and have sex with other people on their own without the other one present. After nearly walking out of last nights social, Jamie and Sharmayne still arent sure how far they can go, so non-monogamy coach Effy orchestrates a sexy pool party to help them loosen up. After a cocktail date with resident couple Jen and Marc, theyre forced to make the ultimate decision

programme.title: Celebrity First Dates
programme.desc: TV weather presenter Sian Lloyd is wary of media attention after the collapse of her marriage, but gourmet cheese merchant Max is intent on melting her heart. Daniel Brocklebank - aka Coronation Street vicar Billy - fears kiss-and-tells, so wants to meet someone who doesnt know who he is. American Dustin may be just the man - if he can get over how similar they are. This instalment also sees Made in Chelsea star Jess Woodley meet up with wide-boy entrepreneur Luke, and Educating Yorkshire participant Musharaf Asghar embark on his first ever date

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, focusing their attentions on Sitting on a Fortune, Close to Me, You, Nadiyas Fast Flavours, Animal, UFO Witness, This Mornings Spin to Win feature and the ITV News. Narrated by Craig Cash. From November 2021

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: Keith draws a line in the sand with Danni, while Gary grows frustrated with Emmas lack of improvement. A sweet 16 celebration gives Cloyce the chance to impress

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Pritchett-Dunphy-Tucker clan prepares for Manny and Lukes graduation, but Jay must pick up the pieces when Mannys dad takes his son on a big night out

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Mamas
programme.desc: Marge joins a womens group, but soon discovers her fellow members plan to steal $1million from Mr Burns. Meanwhile, Lisa decides to spend the summer in Rome and hires a tutor to teach her Italian. Unfortunately, he turns out to be Milhouse

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Cut off from his fathers fortune, Raj struggles to balance his books, so decides to appoint Sheldon to organise his finances and get him out of debt. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con because she thinks Leonard wants her to come along

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldons old room to Raj after he is forced to move out of his apartment to save money, leading to unexpected conflict among the gang and some unwanted observations from Leonards mother. Christine Baranski guests

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Dave drops by Calvins long-time barbershop, he is quickly embraced by its owner and patrons, much to Calvins consternation

programme.desc: A skier falls over on a steep slope and suffers a suspected brain injury in Wakefield and a DIY enthusiasts attempts to fix the heating in his chilly home end in disaster

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The start of the new school term leads to a spate of stabbings and a forester is badly injured in an accident involving a chainsaw deep in woods near Keighley

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: The team joins the search for a missing aeroplane pilot and passenger. A man digging for antique bottles in a South Yorkshire tip is buried alive, leading to a desperate fight to save him

programme.title: 999 Rescue Squad
programme.desc: A student climber plunges from a cliff face in Wharfedale and the team fears he has broken his neck. The medics are also called to treat the victim of a stabbing at a meat plant

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and an elite team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. They are on their way to meet experts who have discovered ancient cave art thought to be among the oldest on the planet. But they have also heard rumours that the mountain range contains further unmapped caves - and Steve wants to be the first to track them down, and whatever is hidden within

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve is on a mission to explore the Arctic at the most volatile and dangerous time of the year - the spring melt. Paddling through ever-shifting sea ice and kayaking the worlds largest fjord, he and his team are on constant alert for giant icebergs and hungry polar bears

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve travels deep into Yucatán, Mexico, on the trail of the ancient Maya. His team, including Mexican archaeologist Guillermo de Andaa, pioneering cave diver Robbie Schmittner and former Royal Marine Aldo Kane, want to explore secret caves known as the place of fear

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Gainsborough to Ely, along the way learning about a Victorian machine that changed shopping for ever and the poet Alfred Tennyson

programme.title: Time Lock
programme.desc: A boy manages to get himself locked in a bank vault. With 63 hours before the device opens, the authorities are left facing a race against time to free the lad before he runs out of air. Thriller, starring Robert Beatty, Betty McDowall, Vincent Winter, Lee Patterson and a young Sean Connery in an early role

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: A cavalry doctor is determined to help deal with a malaria epidemic on a Kiowa reservation. However, his fellow soldiers disapprove of his compassionate attitude, while the tribes medicine man resents outside interference. When the Native Americans attack the fort, the medic is branded a traitor. Western, starring Robert Francis, Donna Reed, May Wynn and Phil Carey

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, starring Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: A princess tires of a tour of European capitals and runs away from her entourage while in Rome. An American newspaper reporter takes her under his wing in the hope of getting an exclusive, but as he shows her the sights of the city, he starts to fall in love with her. Romantic comedy, starring Audrey Hepburn, Gregory Peck, Eddie Albert and Harcourt Williams

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: A widowed father is coping badly with his wifes death, but his son is convinced that what he really needs is some new romance in his life. He arranges for his dad to go on a radio phone-in show, and his touching story moves a reporter to respond, even though she is already engaged. She returns to her fiance, but the boy, certain she is the woman for his father, plots to bring them together. Romantic comedy, with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: The Last King of Scotland
programme.desc: A Scottish doctor takes an overseas job in 1970s Uganda, just as notorious dictator Idi Amin comes to power. The naive medic is soon occupying a privileged position in the presidents inner circle, but as Amins erratic behaviour intensifies, he slowly becomes aware of the horrific campaign of violence and murder being committed by the despot. Political thriller, starring an Oscar-winning Forest Whitaker alongside James McAvoy and Gillian Anderson

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: A woman trapped in a loveless marriage to the future king of England falls for an aristocrat romantically linked to a possessive countess. Period drama, starring Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay and Flora Robson

programme.title: Storm Over the Nile
programme.desc: A British Army officer resigns his commission on the eve of a campaign in Sudan to be with his fiancee. His comrades accuse him of cowardice, and when he learns his girlfriend thinks the same, he becomes determined to salvage his reputation. Disguised as an Arab, he finally has the chance to redeem himself when his friends are captured in battle. Period adventure based on The Four Feathers, with Laurence Harvey, Anthony Steel, Ronald Lewis and Mary Ure

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A Second World War naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Comedy, starring Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: An ageing assassin is targeted by a mysterious young operative that seems able to anticipate his every move. Discovering that hes being hunted by a younger clone of himself, Henry needs to find out why hes being targeted and who the creator is. Action drama, starring Will Smith, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Clive Owen

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielbergs fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: Mean Streets
programme.desc: A small-time crook collecting protection money for his gangster uncle hopes to rise in the world of organised crime, but he is troubled by his conscience and loyalty to his girlfriend. As penance, he takes it upon himself to control a trouble-making friends self-destructive impulses. Martin Scorseses drama, starring Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Amy Robinson, Robert Romanus and Victor Argo

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: A timid man who feels powerless to change his unhappy life is surprised to find his new co-worker is his exact physical double, but that they are complete opposites in personality. To his horror, the outgoing new arrival begins taking over his life. Thriller based on Fyodor Dostoevskys novel, starring Jesse Eisenberg and Mia Wasikowska

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hollister assumes the identity of the jailed Burt Taggert to try to stop Juan Diego attacking Tombstone, since Taggert has links with Diego to supply dynamite and they have never met

programme.title: Tombstone Territory

programme.title: Lawman

programme.title: The High Chaparral

programme.desc: Steve and Lloyd stake out Pats house to find out whether he is married, while Sean struggles to keep up with Violets demands. Vera has a change of heart.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin have their first therapy session together - though neither of them was expecting they would be given homework - while Morwenna is not happy about it when a teenager on work experience starts trying to boss her around in the surgery. Mrs Tishell is surprised when her husband Clive returns and tells her he wants to give things another go, and Louisa has to call Martin when one of her pupils collapses during a school excursion. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient who set fire to his own shop (guest star Tony Slattery) attempts to avoid police questioning by leaping into an ambulance and driving off towards the pier - unaware Alun and a sick man are in the back of the vehicle. Meanwhile, Dr Makori fears for her relationship with Dr Fox when he tells her he has been offered a job in Biafra. Medical drama, with Andy Wear, Paul Fox and Kananu Kirimi

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock investigates a suspicious road accident, and has to suffer the embarrassment of interrogating the High Sheriff about his involvement in the incident. Meanwhile, Gina has shattering news for Phil Bellamy, and Vernon opens a marriage bureau, which proves to have unforeseen consequences - for David at least. Rural drama, guest starring Angela Douglas (Carry On Cowboy)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.sub-title: Gin a Body, Meet a Body
programme.desc: Bellamy finds himself in over his head when he allows personal feelings to cloud his judgement in the case of a robbery suspect. Meanwhile, Vernon hopes great things will come of his newly installed party phone line. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Billy returns to the village, leaving Diane unnerved and Victoria suspicious. Perdy feels Gray may be moving too fast with the surrogacy plans.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jack confronts Diane over her affair with Billy and refuses to believe her version of events - declaring their marriage is over. Perdy admits shes struggling to trust Gray again.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eileen and Pat agree to end their fling, while Jodie issues a warning after Cilla calls pest-control to the takeaway. Molly finds looking after the Duckworths hard work.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Liam returns to a surprise when he finds Carla in charge of the factory. Eileen tries to find out where she stands with Pat and Leanne discovers the cost of big business.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: With the estates future hanging in the balance, Mary hopes to receive a bailout from her grandmother Martha - and with Violets help, tries to make sure Downton puts on a bigger show than ever before with a grand party for friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes hears worrying news, and OBriens efforts to boost Alfreds progress meets with disapproval from Thomas. Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Shirley MacLaine and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After reaching breaking point with being followed around by Buddy, Martin resolves to find a vet to have it put down, while Ruth finds out that Bert has been trying to make his own whisky. Clive is suspicious of Mrs Tishell and who she might be cooking meals for, Penhale makes a hash of asking Janice out, and Louisa and Martins therapy homework results in a picnic on the beach, where they are interrupted by local vet Angela Sim - who appears to be hallucinating. Comedy drama, guest starring Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An investigation into the appearance of forged bank notes in Aidensfield leads to the discovery of a major crime operation, and Blaketon is persuaded to try a new image by Vernon _ with unfortunate repercussions. Meanwhile, Mikes suggestion that he and Jackie start a family is not met with the expected response. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The constabulary receives help from the Met to target a local drug trafficker, believed to be the boyfriend of Lord Ashfordlys sister Patricia. Meanwhile, a domestic drama involving Jackies friend and her baby leaves Mike torn between the loyalties of work and home, and Vernon plans to take advantage of a postal strike. Rural police drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Jason Durr

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe as Barnaby and Jones investigate. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A depressive gambler is found dead, the apparent victim of suicide. Dr Jane Moore, who once treated the man, is adamant he wouldnt have taken his own life - a theory backed up by the post-mortem. Thrilled to be working with Jane again, Barnaby investigates the case - and it isnt long before another of the doctors patients is killed. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Isla Blair, Jan Ravens and Daniel Casey

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Tony investigates the violent murder of a prostitute, and learns the prime suspect was confined to a high-security psychiatric unit at the time. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa helps out her ex-boyfriend Danny when he brings seven children from London to camp on Ruths farm - supervised by Al and Bert - while she and Martin plan a date on the advice of Dr Timoney. However, their night at the restaurant is interrupted when Danny calls saying one of the youngsters has gone missing. Things get worse for the couple when Martin uncovers a health scare at Jamess first birthday party that makes all the guests leave very quickly. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie is assigned to act for a businessman accused of raping a fellow hotel guest during a conference, but she is not sure whether to believe he is innocent or not. Meanwhile, Vernon and David are dismayed to find their finances have hit rock-bottom and find themselves forced to seek employment to pay their electricity bill. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman, David Lonsdale and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The constabulary are on guard as the village is plagued by a series of mysterious explosions, while a redundant church provides Vernon and David with their next fortune-hunting endeavour. Nostalgic drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Anglers flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake. Their peace is ruined however when hundreds of sporting enthusiasts descend on the area for the Psycho Mud Run. Following the bitterness, fishing hooks and barbs are discovered hidden within the race obstacles before someone is found fatally electrocuted. Barnaby is left working out whether his death was another part of a sabotage gone wrong. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer Parva hosts the revival of a traditional pagan festival, but tragedy strikes when curate Alex Dakin is burned alive inside a straw effigy of a woman. The body count rises as an apparent victim of spontaneous combustion, a budding photographer and a newly arrived schoolteacher are the next to be roasted alive. Keith Barron guest stars

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Hill investigates a series of mysterious deaths resembling the various martyrdoms of Christian saints and realises they are being instigated by a shadowy figure who presides over a sinister suicide cult. programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: Sonic Prime
programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths a pair of floral chairs, a chipboard chest of drawers and a collection of antique hardware from the rubbish heap, hoping to breathe new life into them and make some cash for the original owners

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Natasha Raskin Sharp head south to Hertfordshire in the super glam 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles takes part in a whirlwind shopping dash and also finds time to travel to Waddesdon in Buckinghamshire and the home of Baron Ferdinand De Rothschild. Natasha spends over £300, including a Victorian ink and wash painting of a grumpy girl and a stunning 19th-century Italian bronze vase

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst explore Cumbria in a campervan, picking up a Scots Guards picture, a rare Scottish jug, and some silver jewellery

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus helps an antiques dealer clear her home of treasures to fund a holiday. He also assists a woman sell her late uncles collection of spoons

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Its crunch time for antiques experts Izzie Balmer and Tim Medhurst as they conclude their epic road trip around Wales. Tim goes on a veritable spending spree that includes an arts and crafts letter box, while Izzie hopes that two Chinese vases bearing the symbol for good fortune will prove to be an auspicious purchase

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Kika and Dr Amit head to the florist to buy flowers for Amits wife Seema. But theyll need some help from the top secret bumpy bits - the clever dots and lines on the pavement that contain secret messages for visually impaired people - and their guide dogs. First, Kika and Amit have to find the footpath, which is next to a cycle lane. Then, Kika guides Amit down the steps to the crossing near the flower shop, which has a tail of bumpy bits all the way across the pavement. But on their way back, Kika finds the crossing blocked by a fallen tree branch. She has to engage her super sit, where she refuses to continue until its safe. Kika summons her super sight once more and sets off in search of a different crossing to get Amit and his flowers home safely.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Tinks is excited to visit the allotments again with her owner Charli to see how tall their sunflowers have grown. Tinks is a disability assistance dog for Charli and uses her super fetch skills and big dog energy to help Charli every day. But at the allotments, their sunflowers have vanished! Charli says its a mystery - and detective Tinks sets out to solve the case. She quickly finds some footprints, a trail of petals and sunflower seeds, and some not particularly helpful gnomes. She follows the trail of clues to the shed - and finds that it contains their one remaining sunflower! Together, Charli and Tinks wait in hiding, staking out the shed - can they solve their sunflower mystery?

programme.desc: Donal Skehan demonstrates how to cook signature, no-fuss recipes for busy weeknights, proving that dinner doesnt need to be complicated.
